snippet: Brig. Gen. Mohammed Nour Ezzedeen Khallouf, who was in charge of army supplies and logistics, has joined the rebels against President Bashar al-Assad.
abstract: Gen Salim Idris, high-ranking Syrian general who once led military intelligence office widely believed to be torture site, defects from army day after rebels' top military commander again called for members of armed forces to join uprising against Pres Bashar al-Assad; Assad's government calls on world's developing powers to help stop conflict and find political solution to uprising.

byline.contributor: Hania Mourtada and Hwaida Saad contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Brig. Gen. Mohammed Nour Ezzedeen Khallouf, who was in charge of army supplies and logistics, has joined the rebels against President Bashar al-Assad.

headline.main: Assad Issues a Worldwide Plea as a Top Syrian General Defects
headline.print_headline: Assad Issues a Worldwide Plea As a Top Syrian General Defects
